Package org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.external.samples

Class PushbotAutoDriveByGyro_Linear

java.lang.Object
LinearOpMode
org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.external.samples.PushbotAutoDriveByGyro_Linear
public class PushbotAutoDriveByGyro_Linear extends LinearOpMode
This file illustrates the concept of driving a path based on Gyro heading and encoder counts. It uses the common Pushbot hardware class to define the drive on the robot. The code is structured as a LinearOpMode The code REQUIRES that you DO have encoders on the wheels, otherwise you would use: PushbotAutoDriveByTime; This code ALSO requires that you have a Modern Robotics I2C gyro with the name "gyro" otherwise you would use: PushbotAutoDriveByEncoder; This code requires that the drive Motors have been configured such that a positive power command moves them forward, and causes the encoders to count UP. This code uses the RUN_TO_POSITION mode to enable the Motor controllers to generate the run profile In order to calibrate the Gyro correctly, the robot must remain stationary during calibration. This is performed when the INIT button is pressed on the Driver Station. This code assumes that the robot is stationary when the INIT button is pressed. If this is not the case, then the INIT should be performed again. Note: in this example, all angles are referenced to the initial coordinate frame set during the the Gyro Calibration process, or whenever the program issues a resetZAxisIntegrator() call on the Gyro. The angle of movement/rotation is assumed to be a standardized rotation around the robot Z axis, which means that a Positive rotation is Counter Clock Wise, looking down on the field. This is consistent with the FTC field coordinate conventions set out in the document: ftc_app\doc\tutorial\FTC_FieldCoordinateSystemDefinition.pdf Use Android Studios to Copy this Class, and Paste it into your team's code folder with a new name. Remove or comment out the @Disabled line to add this opmode to the Driver Station OpMode list

  • Method Details

    • runOpMode

      public void runOpMode()

    • gyroDrive

      public void gyroDrive​(double speed, double distance, double angle)
      Method to drive on a fixed compass bearing (angle), based on encoder counts. Move will stop if either of these conditions occur: 1) Move gets to the desired position 2) Driver stops the opmode running.
      Parameters:
      speed - Target speed for forward motion. Should allow for _/- variance for adjusting heading
      distance - Distance (in inches) to move from current position. Negative distance means move backwards.
      angle - Absolute Angle (in Degrees) relative to last gyro reset. 0 = fwd. +ve is CCW from fwd. -ve is CW from forward. If a relative angle is required, add/subtract from current heading.

    • gyroTurn

      public void gyroTurn​(double speed, double angle)
      Method to spin on central axis to point in a new direction. Move will stop if either of these conditions occur: 1) Move gets to the heading (angle) 2) Driver stops the opmode running.
      Parameters:
      speed - Desired speed of turn.
      angle - Absolute Angle (in Degrees) relative to last gyro reset. 0 = fwd. +ve is CCW from fwd. -ve is CW from forward. If a relative angle is required, add/subtract from current heading.

    • gyroHold

      public void gyroHold​(double speed, double angle, double holdTime)
      Method to obtain & hold a heading for a finite amount of time Move will stop once the requested time has elapsed
      Parameters:
      speed - Desired speed of turn.
      angle - Absolute Angle (in Degrees) relative to last gyro reset. 0 = fwd. +ve is CCW from fwd. -ve is CW from forward. If a relative angle is required, add/subtract from current heading.
      holdTime - Length of time (in seconds) to hold the specified heading.

    • getError

      public double getError​(double targetAngle)
      getError determines the error between the target angle and the robot's current heading
      Parameters:
      targetAngle - Desired angle (relative to global reference established at last Gyro Reset).
      Returns:
      error angle: Degrees in the range +/- 180. Centered on the robot's frame of reference +ve error means the robot should turn LEFT (CCW) to reduce error.

    • getSteer

      public double getSteer​(double error, double PCoeff)
      returns desired steering force. +/- 1 range. +ve = steer left
      Parameters:
      error - Error angle in robot relative degrees
      PCoeff - Proportional Gain Coefficient
      Returns:
